page.title: 05MARYFELL AND SCHOOLS
page.content: On the east side of Sedbergh is one of the main residential areas of the town, namely{Maryfell}- a typical council housing estate consisting of identical rows of grey houses and three storey flats with small grass areas fronting on to the road. {Sedbergh Primary School}next to the estate was built to a very modern design with the classrooms and hall having a steeply sloping roof to one side, the remaining parts of the building having a flat roof which is constantly leaking despite numerous repairs. On the same beautifully situated campus is{Settlebeck High {School}which must be one of the smallest high schools in the country, the number of pupils on roll this year (11 to 16) exceeding 200 for the very first time.
